page.title: 08ALBERT HALL FIRE,BOLTON
page.content: Part of the Town Hall is occupied by the Albert Hall and this great room with its Victorian architecture is the pride of the town.On 14th November 1981 a fire started in the hall and for 5 hours it burned fiercely.The flames could be seen for miles,especially in the darkness.All the wooden screens,the organ and seating was destroyed.Only the thick Victorin walls saved the rest of the Town Hall from damage or even total destruction.Since then the hall has been rebuilt;instead of one great room with a high ceiling,an extra floor has been added to make 2 rooms.The main one is still called the Albert Hall and has a new organ,a stage,and seating for 1000 people.It was reopened in May 1985 and is the focus of town events.
